Class TripleTriadView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • TripleTriadView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class TripleTriadView
extends java.awt.Canvas
    Handles drawing to the canvas visually placing cards etc. Represents the model of the board on the screen. Objects are drawn by [][] array convention with indices starting from 0. The size of the screen and basis for calculations depends on the scaled width of the packaged card files. by default this is 200px by 200px making the view a 5 by 5 tiled representation where each tile is 200px by 200px
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Keagen Thomson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.awt.Point calculatePoint​(int boardIndex)
      Calculates and returns the row column[][] representation of the board's 1 dimensional index
      void drawBoard​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the board to the middle of the screen
      void drawCard​(java.awt.Graphics g, Card card, int widthIndex, int heightIndex)
      Draws a layered card placing the card background below the card's face and the cards ranks above its face.
      void drawCardColorBackground​(java.awt.Graphics g, Card card, int widthIndex, int heightIndex)
      Draws the card's background: Red, Blue, or Neutral(Purple) at a row and column
      void drawCardFace​(java.awt.Graphics g, Card card, int widthIndex, int heightIndex)
      Draws a card's face at a [][] view index based on its name
      void drawCardRanks​(java.awt.Graphics g, Card card, int widthIndex, int heightIndex)
      Draws the ranks for a card on all 4 sides
      void drawCardsOnBoard​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the cards played to the board at the appropriate index representation which is calculated by another method and depends on the width (in tiles or "indexes") of the board.
      void drawCurrentTurn​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      If the game isn't complete it draws the current players turn in the top row middle column.
      void drawHand​(java.awt.Graphics g, Hand hand, int widthIndex)
      Draws a hand by staying in a column then incrementing its heightIndex by one and drawing the next card
      void drawHands​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Calls the draw hand method for both players
      void drawRank​(java.awt.Graphics g, Card card, int widthIndex, int heightIndex, int side)
      Draws the ranks by calculating the midpoint of the card's current position and offsetting it by 85% of the card's width in the appropriate direction
      void drawScore​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the current score on the bottom row in the column adjacent to the respective player
      void loadBoardImage()
      Loads the 3x3 board by its full file name.
      void loadCardBackgroundImages()
      Loads all the color background files as images into a mapped dictionary by their prefix
      void loadCardFaceImages()
      Loads all the monster card faces files as images into a mapped dictionary by their prefix
      void loadCardRankImages()
      Loads all the card ranks files as images into a mapped dictionary by their prefix
      void loadImages()
      Calls all loading methods in a wrapper.
      void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      calls all draw methods and paints them to the canvasa
      void setWindowSize​(int tilesWide, int tilesHigh)
      Sets the window size to X by Y based on the scaled width (200px default) of the packaged cards.

        public void loadBoardImage()
        Loads the 3x3 board by its full file name. the board by default is 3x3 the unscaled dimensions of a given card

        public void loadImages()
        Calls all loading methods in a wrapper. Used to load images in the constructor so they can be drawn to the canvas

        Parameters:

      • drawRank

        public void drawRank​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                     Card card,
                     int widthIndex,
                     int heightIndex,
                     int side)
        Draws the ranks by calculating the midpoint of the card's current position and offsetting it by 85% of the card's width in the appropriate direction
        Parameters:
        side - is the direction a rank is supposed to be drawn. Should be 0-3 representing the four sides in clockwise order starting from the top (0)

      • drawCard

        public void drawCard​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                     Card card,
                     int widthIndex,
                     int heightIndex)
